summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2020 discussing logistical planning for a victim briefing related to the Epstein investigation. It involves coordination between FBI Victim Services Division personnel, Department of Justice officials, and victims' attorneys Brad Edwards and Paul Cassell regarding a meeting location in Florida.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the attorneys representing Epstein victims who believes Florida would be the best location for a victim briefing meeting.

persons.name: Paul Cassell
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Brad Edwards as an attorney representing Epstein victims who recommends Florida as the meeting location.

connections.description: Both are attorneys representing victims in the Epstein case and are coordinating together on logistics for a victim briefing.

events.title: Planning for victim briefing meeting
events.description: Coordination between DOJ, FBI Victim Services, and victims' attorneys to organize a briefing for victims of Jeffrey Epstein, with discussion of holding it in Florida within the next 2-3 weeks.

events.title: Initial planning call scheduled
events.description: The Department of Justice, in early stages of planning a meeting with victims, schedules a call to discuss the best way to proceed.

locations: Miramar, Florida (mentioned as possible location of FBI field office)
keyFacts: In October 2020, the DOJ and FBI were actively planning a victim briefing related to the Epstein investigation.

Attorneys Brad Edwards and Paul Cassell, representing victims, recommended Florida as the meeting location because most of their clients were located there and preferred not to travel during the pandemic.
An FBI building in Broward County (possibly the Miramar field office) was considered as a potential venue.
The email chain reveals coordination between the FBI Victim Services Division and the DOJ's National Child Exploitation & Human Trafficking Coordinator.

Multiple redacted names (appearing as blanks or placeholders) are present in the correspondence, indicating involvement of several government officials and victim specialists whose identities are not disclosed in this document.
